task.title: Flash Builder setup instructions
task.shortdesc: If you are using Flash Builder, set up your environment as follows.

prereq.p: This guide assumes that you already requested a Flash Player Feature Authorization token.

step.cmd: Create a new workspace in Flash Builder that is pointing to the samples/ReferencePlayer/src/libsfolder that you created earlier in the process.
Create a new substitution variable named PMP_LOC in the Eclipse workspace.

info.note: You need to do this now or you will not be able to import the projects into Flash Builder.

substep.cmd: Define a new path variable named PMP_LOC.
substep.info: The value must be the full path name to your Primetime Reference source folder. For example, /Users/username/Documents/PSDK-FlashRuntime/samples/PrimetimeReference/src.

step.cmd: In the Import dialog, choose Select root directory.
Click Browse and navigate to the PrimetimeReference/projects/flashbuilder folder within the main workspace folder that you created earlier in the process.
step.stepresult: You should now see seven projects that can be imported.

Flash Builder should import and compile all the projects and they should be visible in the Project Explorer. If there are warnings about missing SWCs, you might need to change the build order. See Change the project build order in the Using Flash Builder help system.
The build order should be as follows:
ToggleButton
ReferenceCore
AdvertisingOverlay
ClosedCaptionMenu
SettingsMenu
ReferencePlaybar
ReferencePlayer

step.cmd: Open the PrimetimeReference.mxml file and run it.
step.stepresult: You might need to clean the workspace. To clean the workspace, select ProjectCleanClean All Projects.

result.p: When first running the Primetime reference implementation, you might get the following runtime error: Error #1014: Class flash.system::AuthorizedFeatures could not be found".

If you receive this error you will need to edit your flex-config.xml template file in your Flex SDK as follows:
In your Flash Builder installation directory, open sdks/4.6.0/frameworks/flex-config.xml for edit.
Change target-player to 11.9.
Change swf-version to 22.
In Flash Builder, clean all projects and rebuild.
